greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array related to tennis ball problem, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
D. Merlini, R. Sprugnoli and M. C. Verri, The tennis ball problem, J. Combin. Theory, A 99 (2002), 307-344. (Fig. A.3)
formula: Let c, d, and g be given by: c(t) = (1-sqrt(1-4*t))/(2*t), d(t) = (1-(1+2*t)*sqrt(1-4*t) -(1- 2*t)*sqrt(1+4*t) +sqrt(1-16*t^2))/(4*t^2), and g(t, r) = d(t)*t^(r+1)*c(t)^(r+3). The rows of the triangle are calculated by the expansion of g(t, n-k) for n>=0, 0 <= k <= n. - _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 22 2003
ext: Terms a(29) onward added by _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2019
